For godsake, walk away from it.     Leave it...
Yeah, well, Can I, uh, can I make a credit card call on that phone?
Excuse me, what are you looking at, All Due Respect?
Well, thank you, Sir. It would be nice, to meet a gentleman... to meet a gentleman for once in my life... But I, uh... I, uh...
I, uh... thank you, I just need to uh...
In fact, you know, I'm fine... I had a fight with my husband... and he said... I said...
Replies.Didascalie: (cont'd) (AS SHE LOOKS BACK AT THE PHONE)

Replies.Reply: ...that was the stupidest thing... the stupidest thing that...
I gave you up, Baby.     I gave up the gold.
I gave you up. I had to.
Leave him some money. Give him some money...
That's the right way to do it.
Yeah.   I heard. I'm sorry about that.
No, anything you do, you got to do full-out.
That's right. That's what you taught me.
I went to a good school.
You shouldn't of sent me to him.
Cause it's over. It's all done.    That's the deal.
...the best laid plans of mice and men...
...pretty little girl like that, wouldn't stay away too long...
You should of shot the girl.
On the other thing, Good News! We got the go ahead, we got a date. I got a firm date on the swiss thing.
They got your picture in drag.     Witcher warpaint on.
You goin down, a Body Shop?
...old as you are, it's a good deal.
That they are and indeed they are.     How you doing, Bobby?
Anything you guys want, you're here? Y'want to get a present for the Little Lady...
No, you're the Boss Hog, Joe.
Nobody... gets the goods like you...
And half of that's yours.     You n'your team.
...I told you we're on for the "other"
It's the shot of the century.
I'm locked into it. It's such a beautiful deal, Joe... we waited so long.
...I put myself, n'my friends in hock, set the deal up...
This Swiss thing? After how long we waited...?
Replies.Didascalie: (HE PICKS UP A SHEAF OF PAPERS FROM HIS DESK.)

Replies.Reply: ...I was a publisher man, I'd publish the plans... it's the Mona Lisa.
Yeah, no, I'm saying, that's what I would do, f'I was in the book business. Unfortunately, I'm a thief, so, I have to do that thing.
Well, look here, it's the Golden   Rule. You know the Golden Rule. Whoever's    got the Fucken Gold, he gets to make the   Rule... Huh?
Huh...? Look: The normal course      of events...
I'm in HOCK to my PEOPLE for the TOYS, all the TOYS YOU told me you need, do the Other thing...
I want you do do the Swiss job.
Well, now, that's bullshit, Joe, you know that, you just tol me you're goin travelling--
...I don't think your friend likes me...
Well, then, it's not alright.     What are you telling me...?
You think about it, Joe. I got your money sitting for you, right here. You do the job, and I swear to you...
I'm sorry I put you in a position.
...you're ahead of me every turn.    How about that.
...the date holds, you got the shipment on the fourteenth.
...my boy goes on the job with you.
Replies.Didascalie: (cont'd) (MOTIONING AT BELLA AS THEY JOIN THE OTHER GROUP)

Replies.Reply: THE TWO HAVE WALKED UP TO PINCUS AND BLANE.
Y'ever split a piece of cake? One kid gets to cut the cake, the other gets to choose.
You go with the gold. That's the deal.
Are you fucken with me? Are you fucken with me, or are you done fucken with me? Because I've just "financialized" the problem, and you've just become more trouble than you're worth.
She says you're gonna do the job. You said that before, why now? What is it, all a sudden...?
Everyone needs money. That's why they call it "money..."

Well, let me add this sweetener. You do the job. You do the job, r'else I turn you over, I drop a fucken dime on you, you're so hot, I on'y got to dial five digits. How strict is that? How strict is that, you fucken lame?
You're in my position, what do you do?
...she did.    She came to plead for him?
The sonofabitch screwed me once, he's gone screw me again. Why, why, why would she think that I'd believe her?
He put her up, to come to you.
Well, no, but as Rational Men, don't we have to "doubt" her?
Then, let me put a question to you: you had the job... you had the job... how would you test her sincerity...?
Okay, we're All on One Team, all arrayed against a Common Enemy? Thank you for coming, I'm an old Man, I'm going to bed...
When we put it to you.
You know when we put it to you, you're gone be telling us the gross national product of Bolivia...
You're gonna be telling us the area codes, Belgium and Luxembourg...
This is all you know. This is all you know...
No, I'm not going to hurt you.   No.
But tell a guy, m fulla admiration.     What was the deal? What was the deal?
Yeah, no.   It's charming.   And then what?
You "slip away." Me and my guys go to the Meet, we find a truck full of Pig Iron. Zat the thing?
He did... And where's the Gold.     Where's the Gold all this time?
Y'know? Your guy din't get it in     his head, fly off on a Variation, we're out    on the Patio right now, and everybody's got a    Margarita.
Yeah, no, where's the Gold, what's the Back-up Plan...?
Take him and show him something...
Yeah, yeah, what there was a change in Plans...? You couldn't get to me to tell me?
Do you mind if I say something personal?
You wife's a whore. She'n'you, 've fucked this perfect little plan, into...
Get up. Get up, get     up, you contrary motherfucker. I was     going to make you rich.
You just gotta complicate it That Last Bit.
Well. Do you want to wrap it up, or you want to stand around out here, guess my Real Name?
You had to go out on a limb -- you had to go out on a limb, Didn't you...? Didn't you...
Yeah, we had, basically, we had in mind a different deal... a different deal. How bout that, I hear, if you're flexible, it Keeps you Young.
Well, that's very sentimental.   But what if the gold's on the boat.
Yeah, no, I don't got to search the boat.
Yeah, no, your wife just made another deal.
Yeah, that's what we did for her, we let you live.
Let's get this boat out of here.
We're letting you live cause it makes the broad happy. That's what she traded us for the gold.
Oh, yeah, let's siddown. You fucken dog inna manger, we sit here a little long enough, the Boys in Blue come visit, n'there goes the neighborhood...
You fortunate motherfucker, she don't step up, you're gone stay here, for, like, a little bit of forever...
...this way you walk away, you Lucky Dog.
Don't make me lose my respect for you. By the way, we already had the gold. Pincus gave it up. That's what she traded for your life.
She's got a very commercial mind...
Get a number, call'im up, we need a private slip, what do you call it, a shed. Tell'im we'll pay in cash. Get the thing squared away, we'll take the gold out...
Yeah, we don't want, to send you out there broke... here: go buy yourself something nice... You don't mind if I pay you in Gold...?
...I don't... I need you to tell me where the gold is.
What is it, with your pal...?
And then   where is he now. Your  running buddy?
AS HE SPEAKS, MOORE KEEPS TURNING, SO THAT THE SUN IS BEHIND MOORE, AND SHINING INTO THE EYES OF BERGMAN AND HIS ACCOMPLICES, WHO NOW STAND WITH THEIR BACKS TO THE BOAT.
Replies.Didascalie: (cont'd) (HE HOLDS OUT HIS HAND. A HENCHMAN PUTS A PISTOL INTO IT.)

Replies.Reply: Two... why must you, oh, God, why in the world must you, why in the hell, a guy like you, would you put me in a position... Aahh, the Hell with it, life is too short, you know what? Fuck you...
Don't you want to hear my dying words...?
Look here, Pal... Look here, Pal... You're the help...
I'm sorry for what I said.
She's on the swingshift. She's got two kids.
What's the story on your pal?
How long's he been with the girl?
How long's he been with her...?
Well, you see, that's what, that's what troubles me.
No, I'm not a religious man.
They worked out on the plan, why all a sudden now, you...
No, no. No. Teach me something: why should it go sour. Was that such a stupid...?
What happened to Check It an Forget it?
Whose fault is that, you wanna think about it? Listen:...
Hey, baby, after this job, you're gone have enough money, make this look like a Boat inna Bathtub.
...what does this do to the Job...?
I forgot my copy of the plans.
You got to do the job, Joe.
Lookit me like I'm your Good Angel.   You can't walk away from it.
You got to do the job...
You got to do the job. Can you shoot me and walk away from it? You know they'll kill you.
You gone shoot me, go on the run, with nothing? With that pretty little thing?
What does she see in you, anyway?
...you must be hung like Man of War...
He's broke. He's made. The cops're looking for him. He don't want to go out there with nothing.
She says that he'll do the job.
I think, the thing, she came to plead for him.
I think she came to me on her own.
She thinks the guy's weak, he's scared, she's scared, I think she's sincere.
I'm going to see you back.

Replies.Didascalie: (AS HE WALKS OVER TO HER SIDE OF THE CAR)

You're burnt, for chrissake.   You're fucken burnt Old Man... What're you,  telling your Beads "I go with the Gold"...  Look here: You tell me: what're they gonna   be looking harder at? You tell me, you   here with us, or you in an empty car.

...I think pretty good off my feet, too.

And the prize in the Crackerjack.

What're you, filled with Remorse, something...?
Yes, Indeed it is, but I'm going to tell you something...
Take your hands off the wheel...
What are you, nuts? Are you nuts? We're going to... I'll tell you what we're gonna do.
...we're gonna. That lame, that old lame you were with... he was... what did you think he was? He was a non-starter... what did you think...
Well, yeah, no, I told you... we aren't going to the Meet.
You know we aren't going there.
Why would we want to go there...?
You want me to tell you why...?
There is no meet, for the luvva God.   You know that.
Yeah. I'll get you a drink, and here's a bracer... We left the meet at the Airport.

...we can get a few, we can bury the bars, if we bury the bars in the...

Replies.Reply: PINCUS, IN A BUSINESS SUIT. STANDING BY WHAT APPEARS TO BE A LARGE SAMPLE CASE, WAITING AT A BANK OF PHONES. HE LOOKS AT HIS WATCH.

AS FRAN LOOKS OUT OF THE WINDOW.
